questions.text: On which date is Republic Day celebrated in India?
questions.explanation:
Republic Day is celebrated on 26 January every year to commemorate the day when the Constitution of India came into effect in 1950.

Other important national days:
- 15 August: Independence Day
- 2 October: Gandhi Jayanti
- 14 November: Children's Day

Republic Day marks India's transition to a sovereign republic with its own constitution.

questions.text: Who wrote the Indian National Anthem 'Jana Gana Mana'?
questions.explanation:
Rabindranath Tagore wrote the Indian National Anthem 'Jana Gana Mana'. He was a Bengali polymath who was also awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1913 for his work 'Gitanjali'.

Other contributions by Tagore:
- Wrote 'Vande Mataram' music (lyrics by Bankim Chandra Chatterjee)
- First Asian to win Nobel Prize in Literature
- Founded Shantiniketan

The National Anthem was adopted on 24 January 1950.

questions.text: What is the highest civilian award in India?
questions.explanation:
Bharat Ratna is the highest civilian award in India. It was established in 1954 and is awarded for exceptional service in any field of human endeavor.

Order of civilian awards (highest to lowest):
1. Bharat Ratna
2. Padma Vibhushan
3. Padma Bhushan
4. Padma Shri

Maximum 3 Bharat Ratna awards can be given in a year. The first recipients in 1954 were C. Rajagopalachari, Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, and C.V. Raman.
